channel.title: Times of India

item.title: Covid-19: 81% of Omicron patients in Maharashtra were fully vaccinated
item.description: Eighty-one per cent of the 54 patients detected with the Omicron variant in Maharashtra are cases of breakthrough infections, i.e. they got infected despite being fully vaccinated. A few have even taken a third shot of the Pfizer vaccine. According to experts, this is in sync with growing evidence that the variant can escape immune response and that most vaccines may be unable to stop transmission of Omicron.

item.title: Live: PM transfers Rs 1k cr in bank a/cs of various SHGs
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday attended a programme in Prayagraj to promote women empowerment and transferred Rs 1,000 crore to the bank accounts of self-help groups benefiting 16 lakh women. Stay with TOI for all the latest updates:

item.title: RS passes electoral reforms Bill amid opposition walk out
item.description: The Rajya Sabha on Tuesday passed the 'Election Laws (Amendment) Bill 2021' to link electoral roll data with the Aadhaar ecosystem amid opposition walk out. The Bill was cleared by Lok Sabha on Monday after a brief debate. The opposition wanted the Bill to be referred to a standing committee. However, the government rejected this demand.

item.title: Asian CT semis Live : India take on Japan
item.description: Stay updated with Times of India to get all the live score updates, results and points table of the men's Asian Champions Trophy hockey 2021.

item.title: Live: No parties,mass gatherings from Dec 30 to Jan 2 in K'taka
item.description: Amid a rising concern over Omicron, pharma major Moderna has said that a booster dose of its Covid vaccine is effective against the variant. Indian pharma company Bharat Biotech meanwhile has sought approval for phase-3 trials of its intranasal vaccine. Stay here for the latest updates:

item.title: 17 MLAs to 2: Congress in Goa left stunned, betrayed
item.description: After emerging as the single largest party at the 2017 assembly polls with 17 MLAs, Congress has seen its strength gradually reduce and is now down to two legislators in the House following Curtorim MLA Aleixo Reginaldo Lourencos sudden resignation on Monday. Lourenco is the second Congress MLA to desert the party in the past few days.

item.title: Ashwin recalls a Shastri remark that crushed him
item.description: Ashwin has been a great asset for India in both home and away conditions in the longer format of the game. The spinner has so far taken 427 Test wickets, making him the third-highest wicket-taker from the country after Anil Kumble and Kapil Dev in the red-ball format. But there was a phase between 2018 to 2020 when he almost quit playing.

item.title: Cool gadgets under Rs 1,000 you can buy as Christmas gifts
How Instagram 'became' more like TikTok in 2021
Apple begins iPhone 13 production in India
Celebrities named in Panama Papers controversy
item.description: Aishwarya Rai, Amitabh, Ajay Devgn Celebrities named in Panama Papers controversy

item.title: Rajiv Gandhi father of lynching: BJP retorts to Rahul's attack on Centre
item.description: The BJP has reacted sharply to Congress leader Rahul Gandhis allegation that lynching has become common after the Narendra Modi government came to power at the Centre in 2014. In a personal attack, the ruling party accused former Prime Minister and Rahuls father late Rajiv Gandhi as the father of lynching. On Tuesday morning, Rahul posted a tweet in Hindi and English which said Before 2014, the word lynching was practically unheard of.

item.title: Quick Edit: Will Aadhaar-voter ID linking help clean up the rolls?
Drugs case: FIR lodged against SAD MLA Bikram Majithia
item.description: Punjab police on Monday night registered an FIR against the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) MLA Bikram Singh Majithia in connection with drugs case.

item.title: Ashes cricket tests every part of your game: Gillespie
item.description: Former Australian cricketer Jason Gillespie, who took over 400 international wickets in his career across all three formats, was a guest on Times of India's sports podcast - Sportscast - recently and spoke about what it really means to be a part of an Ashes battle. It is after all cricket's oldest rivalry.

item.title: Golden Temple sacrilege bid: 2 days on, lynched man not identified
item.description: Police have so far not been able to ascertain the identity of the person who committed sacrilege in the sanctum sanctorum of Golden Temple on December 18 evening.

item.title: Bill to increase marriage age for women introduced in LS
item.description: A bill that seeks to have a uniform age of marriage for men and women was introduced in Lok Sabha on Tuesday amid protests by opposition members, with Union minister Smriti Irani urging the chair to refer it to a parliamentary panel.
